{{infobox person | birth_date = {{birthdate and age|1979|8|17}} | image = Eric Toms.jpg | occupation = actor | years active = 2002-present }} '''Eric Toms''' (born August 17, 1979 in [[San Jose, California]])<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1382692/ Eric Toms at IMDB.com]</ref> is a stand-up comedian, American actor and television personality, and host of [[Fox Reality|Fox Reality Channelâs]] [[Reality Binge]].<ref>[http://www.myfoxla.com/myfox/pages/Home/Detail;jsessionid=960B391D525E28EF81E6DCB731C0200B?contentId=7409353&version=2&locale=EN-US&layoutCode=VSTY&pageId=1.1.1&sflg=1/ 2008-09-11 MyFox Los Angeles-KTTV Interview]</ref>
==Career==
After dropping out of San Jose State University in 1998, Eric joined the theater group Big Lilâs in downtown San Jose. Two years after joining, the group created a sketch troupe called âSUTNâ and Toms became a cast member, head writer and video producer.<ref>[http://www.foxreality.com/realitybinge/thehost.php Fox Reality Channel "Reality Binge" page]</ref> The group was signed to a television deal with KRON4 and produced over 50 shows before moving to UPN in San Francisco to produce another 12.<ref>[http://www.erictoms.com/biography.htm/ erictoms.com]</ref> In 2008, Toms won the host role and became a story producer for the comedy clip show ''Reality Binge'' on [[Fox Reality Channel]]. Working on ''Reality Binge'' later led to a guest appearance on [[Good Day LA]] and a number of other panel shows. He guest starred as Gilroy Smith in the ''[[Sonny With a Chance]]'' season 1 finale "Sonny: So Far".
== Film roles ==
In 2001 Toms began his film career in the low-budget indie film ''Pins and Needles''.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0308727/ Pins and Needles on IMDB]</ref> He went on to perform in the historical drama ''Valley of the Heartâs Delight''. In 2008 Toms performed in ''Growing Out'', a film by Graham and Garett Ratliff.<ref>[http://www.myspace.com/eric_toms/ Eric Toms Myspace Page]</ref>
